metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4350 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Yaws 1.91 has a directory traversal vulnerability in the way certain URLs are processed. A remote authenticated user could use this flaw to obtain content of arbitrary local files via specially-crafted URL request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4350` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang-yapp - 1.98-2
erlang-yaws - 1.98-2
yaws - 1.98-2
yaws-chat - 1.98-2
yaws-mail - 1.98-2
yaws-wiki - 1.98-2
yaws-yapp - 1.98-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> possibly related to CVE-2010-4181, but for a different version

criterions.comment: yaws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.98-2').
